title: Senior Associate / Manager, Transaction Advisory (Financial Due Diligence)
description:
**Senior Associate / Manager, Transaction Advisory (Financial Due Diligence)** 




**Global Transaction Advisory Group** 




**Alvarez & Marsal** 




**Stockholm** 




  





**About us** 




 Alvarez & Marsal (“A&M”) is a global consulting firm with more than $3+ billion in revenues, c.9,000+ staff and over 80 offices worldwide. We offer a broad range of professional services including Restructuring, Transaction Advisory, Performance Improvement, Corporate Transformation, Financial Institutions Advisory, Tax, Valuations, and Disputes and Investigation Services.
 



  





 We would like to invite you to join Alvarez & Marsal’s dynamic Transaction Advisory team. Our award-winning practice includes over 1,000 professionals in over 40 offices across the United States, Middle East, Europe, Latin America, India and Asia Pacific. We work for premium clients on a selection of deals sector wide. Our Transactions Advisory team have established Alvarez & Marsal as one of the leading providers of financial due diligence globally and the leading firm to develop a fulfilling career in Transaction Advisory.
 



  





 Alvarez & Marsal’s employees benefit from joining a large network and employee resource groups such as supporting the LGBQT+ community, A&M Young Professionals, EMEA Women’s Network, The Multicultural Network, A&M Parents & Carers Community Group and offering support to those who identify as neurodivergent. Other benefits include but are not limited to flexible working, maternity / paternity leave and access to our Employee Assistance Programme. We are committed to creating a welcoming, diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.
 



  





**Our values** 




 Alvarez & Marsal’s core values lead the day-to-day decision-making practices, we work hard to uphold these values and remain true to our ethos of:
 


* *Integrity*
* *Objectivity*
* *Quality*
* *Inclusive Diversity*
* *Fun*
* *Personal Reward*



  





**What we do** 




 A&M provides investors and lenders the answers needed to get the deal done. We combine our firm’s deep operational, industry and functional resources with quality financial accounting and tax expertise to assess key deal drivers and focus on the root cause of any critical deal issues. The largest Transaction Advisory practice outside the Big Four, our global integrated teams help private equity, hedge fund and corporate acquirers unlock value across the investment cycle.
 



  





**The role** 




 We are growing and continue to expand our established team in Stockholm, we are looking to hire a Senior Associate / Manager with experience in Transactions Advisory and who can support the Transactions Advisory team on Nordic and pan European projects.
 



 As part of our highly skilled team, the successful individual will;
 



  




* Join a growing team with strong leadership, bright, energetic people with a truly entrepreneurial spirit
* Work across the entire deal life cycle in a hands-on role, including both buy-side and sell-side work
* Benefit from more diverse and exciting career opportunities
* Deliver international projects on behalf of many of the most prominent organisations worldwide
* Work with a variety of large-cap and mid-cap PE houses, corporate clients and financial institutions providing broad industry & client exposure
* Contribute to & lead projects & work streams reporting directly to the Managing Directors or Senior Directors
* Work as part of multi-disciplinary teams in Italy and across geographies and build broad international deal experience
* Gain exposure to senior members of the team in Italy and internationally gaining ‘on the job’ learning & development in addition to established formal training programmes
* Use the commercial aspects of your financial analysis skills, in addition to analysing the key drivers and valuation considerations that drive a transaction
* Work alongside A&M’s operational and commercial professionals in combined project teams enhancing your understanding of the broader due diligence & wider deal process
* Network with our service lines and work on external marketing events to build cross- service line relationships



  





 Alvarez & Marsal is an environment that presents a real opportunity for motivated individuals as all employees are encouraged to develop their client network and grow their business development skills. Our team is rewarded in terms of an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to fast track their Transactions Advisory career. Our base salaries are highly competitive and bonuses are un-capped. Employees are rewarded for their contribution to growing both TAG and the broader business.
 



  





**Essential experience:** 



* Experience in Transaction Services (financial due diligence) at a Big 4 firm is essential
* A strong academic record and professional qualifications are helpful
* Native Swedish and fluent English is required. Additional European language skills including French, Dutch, Spanish, German or Swedish are advantageous



  





 A&M’s deep operational and industry expertise provides TAG with a unique opportunity to perform more insightful due diligence by providing an integrated and differentiated approach enabling us to deliver more value to our clients. We are free from audit conflicts and our platform is less restrictive, enabling us to operate cross-border seamlessly.
 



  





**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 It is Alvarez & Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex or gender, gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, family medical history, genetic information or other protected medical condition, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by and in accordance with applicable laws. Employees and Applicants can find A&M policy statements and additional information by region here.
 



  





**Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters** 




 Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening and in alignment with our Inclusive Diversity values. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

title: Director, Australian Research Centre for Cancer Survivorship
description:
This Job is based in Australia
   

  

**Director, Australian Research Centre for Cancer Survivorship**
* Employment Type: Full – time, Continuing Professorial appointment (plus Director position, 10-year appointment)
* Remuneration: Attractive renumeration, generous employer’s contribution to superannuation and benefits
* Location: UNSW Kensington Campus, NSW, Australia.
* Unique opportunity to implement evidence-based interventions that will improve quality of life.


**Australian Research Centre For Cancer Survivorship**
 As a result of a 10-year partnership between UNSW and Cancer Council NSW (CC NSW), the Australian Research Centre for Cancer Survivorship is a recently announced initiative which seeks to provide the evidence base for models of care with a person-centred approach, will inform services and policy in the survivorship space across NSW and will act as a model for other Australian states and territories as well as internationally. The Centre will leverage existing expertise and build new capacity, with which to drive excellence in research, education and advocacy. It will partner with consumers, Primary Health Networks, Local Health Districts, other healthcare providers, Government, Universities, and industry to develop, test and implement and evaluate ambitious solutions which address critical issues for cancer survivors.
   

  

**Why This Opportunity Matters**
 The Director will be the pivotal role in establishing/setting up and delivering on the ambitions of the partnership. This will include responsibility for developing, embedding, communicating, measuring and achieving the Centre’s academic and operational vision, strategies and goals, in overall alignment with the Faculty’s Health 25 Strategy and UNSW’s vision and strategy . In addition, the Director will be responsible for obtaining long-term research funding for the research centre above and beyond the initial 10-year period of funding. The Director will provide strong academic leadership and foster excellence in research, innovative teaching, and engagement activities.
   

  

 The role will work closely with academic and research staff in health systems and services, building research capacity and strengthening collaborations within the faculty and across partners and stakeholders, to translate improved health outcomes for Australians including building the profile of the Centre.
   

  

 The role will report to the Dean of Medicine, but the director is accountable to the Joint UNSW/CC NSW Steering Committee for the performance of the centre.
   

  

**The Successful Appointee Will Have**
* Doctoral qualification with demonstrated outstanding and extensive experience in health administration or leadership at a senior level, a clinical background would be advantageous.
* Demonstrated extensive experience in leading or overseeing large complex projects around the design, delivery and/or evaluation of health services with a deep understanding of the Australian healthcare landscape.
* Distinguished track record in cancer survivorship research.
* Proven ability to apply advanced analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills in a complex multi-stakeholder operating environment.
* Evidence of highly developed interpersonal and collaboration skills with a proven ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Proven extensive leadership in developing significant productive relationships and engagement with external stakeholders, in particular industry, Government and the community.
* Demonstrated capacity to lead by example in supporting equal opportunity and equity, diversity and inclusion policy and programs as they relate to staff and students.


*Full details of the role can be found in the attached position description.*
**UNSW Benefits And Culture**
 An attractive package will be negotiated with the successful applicant, based upon the competitive salaries and benefits offered by UNSW including:
   

  

* 17% Superannuation and leave loading
* Flexible working
* Additional 3 days of leave over the Christmas period
* Access to lifelong learning and career development
* Progressive HR practices


 More information on the great staff benefits and culture can be found here.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please click
 **Apply now** 
 to submit your application online. Applications should not be sent to the contact listed below. Please provide a resume and a detailed cover letter clearly addressing the main skills and experience listed in the position description.
   

  

**Contact For Questions**
 Merita O'Connell – Talent Acquisition, UNSW
   

  

 E: merita.oconnell@unsw.edu.au
   

  

**Applications close:** 
 Sunday, 23rd June before 11.30pm AEST.
   

  

 UNSW is committed to equity diversity and inclusion. Applications from women, people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, those living with disabilities, members of the LGBTIQ+ community; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged. UNSW provides workplace adjustments for people with disability, and access to flexible work options for eligible staff. The University reserves the right not to proceed with any appointment.

title: Director Sustainability & Communication | Billerud
description:
*On behalf of* 
*Billerud* 
 , we are now looking for a
 



  





**Director Sustainability & Communication** 




  





**At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!** 




  





 As a leading supplier of virgin fiber-based paper and packaging materials, with sustainability in our DNA, we are passionately committed to our customers and their businesses every day. We inspire our customers with our expertise and industry knowledge, giving them confidence in making the best and most sustainable packaging choices that also help them reduce their climate impact.
 



  





 Billerud develops paper and packaging materials that challenge conventional packaging for a sustainable future. We are a world-leading company in premium-quality paper and packaging materials made from virgin fiber, with a strong commitment to sustainability, quality, and customer value. The company has ten production units in Sweden, the USA, and Finland, approximately 6,100 employees in more than 13 countries, and customers in over 100 countries. Billerud has an annual turnover of approximately SEK 42.6 billion and is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
 



  





**About the position** 




 In this position, you report to the SVP Procurement & Wood Supply, and you will have an important position in the management team for the entire function. You will be responsible for leading and coaching a dedicated team and developing the business within Sustainability & Communication. You will collaborate closely internally with other departments to strengthen our internal and external communication on sustainability issues and externally with stakeholders and media contacts. You will play a central role in our sustainability work and represent the company in industry associations and in contacts with authorities and forest policy contexts.
 



  





**Areas of responsibility** 



* Leading and coaching team members
* Design and implement sustainability programs that support the company's long-term goals
* Identify and analyze sustainability risks and opportunities within the industry
* Ensure that the company complies with all relevant EU directives and national environmental regulations with a particular focus on the EU Deforestation Regulation (EUDR)
* Organize and oversee regular audits and reporting to verify compliance
* Promote sustainable forestry practices and responsible use of natural resources
* Analyze and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) for sustainability
* Develop and implement internal communication strategies to educate and engage employees in sustainability initiatives
* Foster a sustainability culture within the company
* Manage and coordinate all external communication related to the company's sustainability initiatives and marketing efforts
* Build and maintain relationships with media, stakeholders, and community groups
* Develop campaigns and materials to promote the company's sustainability efforts



  





**About you** 




 To succeed in this position we believe you are a strategic thinker with the ability to see the bigger picture and coordinate long-term goals. You are a leader with the ability to inspire, challenge, and engage others for the best of the company. You possess strong communication skills, both written and verbal. You are diplomatic and skilled at building relationships with stakeholders, customers, and investors. We are looking for an engaged leader with a strong interest in sustainability issues. You recognize yourself in our values: Focus on the customer, dare to try new things, drive change, and care for each other. We place great emphasis on your personality.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Degree within forestry, economics, technical or other relevant field
* Experience from working with sustainability issues at a strategic level
* Work experience from the forestry industry
* Excellent leadership abilities
* Fluent in reading and writing Swedish and English
* Experience from working with forest owners, environmental organizations, and certification processes
* Meritorious is the ability to coordinate and lead projects, such as the implementation of the EU's Forest Directive (EUDR)
* Experience in driving and coordinating sustainability issues and biodiversity programs



  





**What we offer:** 




 We offer an opportunity to become part of a strong international company with a focus on sustainable and profitable development. You will join a highly efficient team of dedicated colleagues who place great emphasis on collaboration.
 



  





**Contact** 




 In this recruitment, we are working with Hudson Nordic as our recruitment partner. If you are interested in the position or have questions about the position, please contact André Högevoll at andre.hogevoll@hudsonnordic.com or +46 (0)709 258 228.
 



  





 Selection and interviews are ongoing, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: ESG Methodology Expert - Methodology Governance
description:
Let’s be #BrilliantTogether
   

  

**Position Overview**
 ISS ESG is seeking an experienced methodology governance expert to join the Global ESG Methodology team in our Stockholm, Brussels or London location.
   

  

 ESG Methodology is a horizontal function across all ESG research and solution verticals, ensuring high quality and consistency of methodologies, innovative solutions, and gold standard in research and resulting signals.
   

  

 The focus of the Methodology Governance Expert role will be to support the Quality Management and Assurance Lead by building out methodology governance structures for the ISS ESG Research team. The Methodology Governance Expert will contribute to executing a Plan-Do-Check-Act cycle and will closely collaborate and cooperate with all relevant respective research and product teams to continuously ensure the highest standards in terms of methodology and quality, as well as consistent approaches and fully integrated solutions across our business.
   

  

 ISS ESG teams are based in the Philippines, the US, Australia, Germany, Sweden, India, and the UK. The successful candidate will work both independently as well as collaboratively with the local team and colleagues across our global offices. Working in a dynamic market and international environment, we put great emphasis on cooperation and offer a welcoming, collegial working atmosphere.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build-up in-depth knowledge and expertise on the methodological framework within ISS ESG, as well as a thorough understanding of ISS ESG solutions
* Further enhance and develop the methodology governance framework within ISS ESG Research and establish protocols and procedures for research with regard to methodological development and change management in cooperation with the Research team, Compliance, and Regulatory team
* Support the development, review, approval, and governance processes of the methodologies that underpin ISS ESG’s solutions
* Leverage key differentiators of research methodologies
* Establish deep relationships and partner with all relevant research and product teams to facilitate further integration of methodologies, processes and outputs based on our quality program
* Oversee consistency and plausibility of methodology and results
* Identify areas with need of improvement, plan and implement changes, and provide training, tools, and techniques to stakeholders to achieve methodological consistency and congruency
* Drive forward the thorough documentation of methodologies and methodology governance procedures, requirements etc.
* Monitor developments in the responsible investment space, review and affirm alignment of our methodology with relevant regulatory and voluntary standards
* Initiate methodology and quality enhancements in line with client and market expectations
* Create and monitor relevant KPIs and quality reporting as it pertains to methodology governance processes
* Support the QM&A team in the implementation of a Quality Management System using the PDCA cycle
* Support internal and external enquiries as they pertain to methodology governance within ISS ESG Research


**Qualifications**
* Have 3 years or more of relevant experience in the area of methodology governance and related processes and practices
* Have 3 years or more of relevant experience in the field of ESG investor research or comparable services to the financial industry
* Experience with or knowledge in quality management regimes and techniques desirable (ISO9001 implementation preferred)
* Solutions- and execution-oriented approach
* Exceptional project management skills. Experience with Project Management tools such as MS Project, Jira, MS Visio, MS Office, SharePoint etc. preferred
* Organizational skills, attention to detail, a self-driven work ethic, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a high-pressure, deadline-driven environment
* Ability to work within a team-oriented cross-functional environment and communicate with various internal parties; experience working with teams located in multiple cities and countries preferred.
* Fluency in English; additional language capabilities are an asset (especially German, French, Japanese, Korean and Mandarin)
* High energy, passion, and drive, with a strong positive outlook.


 #ESG #MIDSENIOR
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Our people are the moving force behind ISS STOXX. We are dedicated to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry and empowering them with the resources and support to enhance their career, health, financial and personal well-being.
   

  

 We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are invested in our people and are working every day to ensure a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace.
   

  

 Let’s empower, collaborate, and inspire one another.
   

  

 Let’s be
 **#BrilliantTogether** 
 .
   

  

**About ISS STOXX**
 ISS STOXX GmbH is a leading provider of research and technology solutions for the financial market. Established in 1985, we offer top-notch benchmark and custom indices globally, helping clients identify investment opportunities and manage portfolio risks. Our services cover corporate governance, sustainability, cyber risk, and fund intelligence. Majority-owned by Deutsche Börse Group, ISS STOXX has over 3,400 professionals in 33 locations worldwide, serving around 6,400 clients, including institutional investors and companies focused on ESG, cyber, and governance risk. Clients trust our expertise to make informed decisions for their stakeholders' benefit.
   

  

 ISS ESG solutions enable investors to develop and integrate sustainable investing policies and practices, engage on responsible investment issues, and monitor portfolio company practices through screening solutions. ISS ESG also provides climate data, analytics, and advisory services to help financial market participants understand, measure, and act on climate-related risks across all asset classes. In addition, ESG solutions cover corporate and country ESG research and ratings enabling its clients to identify material social and environmental risks and opportunities.
   

  

 Visit our website: https://www.issgovernance.com
   

  

 View additional open roles: https://www.issgovernance.com/join-the-iss-team/
   

  

 The Swedish Confederation of Professional Associations (SACO) is a politically independent central organization for 22 unions comprising university graduates in Sweden. You are welcome to contact the local representatives of SACO at ISS-Ethix on SACO@iss-esg.com. However, note that no applications sent to this e-mail address will be accepted.
   

  

*Institutional Shareholder Services (“ISS”) is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. It is our policy to prohibit discrimination or harassment against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, creed, religion, sex, age, height, weight, citizenship status, national origin, social origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, pregnancy status, marital status, familial status, mental or physical disability, veteran status, military service or status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law (referred to as “protected status”). All activities including, but not limited to, recruiting and hiring, recruitment advertising, promotions, performance appraisals, training, job assignments, compensation, demotions, transfers, terminations (including layoffs), benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment, are and will be administered on a non-discriminatory basis, consistent with all applicable federal, state, and local requirements.*

title: Head of Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand
description:
With all brands in the Traton group moving towards a common way of working with product structure in Traton Modular System (TMS) there will be opportunities to co-operate between brands also when it comes to presales preparations and ways of introducing new content to the market. During last year Scania, MAN, Navistar and Hero identified opportunities for cooperation by sharing systems and processes but also in the actual work of taking product data from R&D and moving it to each brand that makes its work with it to make it commercially right in the market.
   

  

 Presales Multibrand is a function within Presales and Sales Readiness that will be hosted by Scania but will support all brands and the joint activities in that area. If you are interested in shaping the future and finding our ways forward together in the group, then this is the job for you. You will work in the management structure of the function Presales Multibrand as head of the group Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The group Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand is a newly created group in the Presales Multibrand function. As the manger for this group you will lead a team of very experienced people and have a key role in the interface to the Multibrand work in MAN, Navistar, Hero as well as Scania. You need to be able to have a long-term view of how this, until now, unexplored area can develop but also an ability to act here and now to ensure high-quality introductions of new product structure and product information.
   

  

 The Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand team consists of experienced and highly motivated team members in the areas of Continuous Introduction, Product Coordination and Product Information. Their responsibilities are content in the presales systems and work a lot in the interface towards R&D but also towards our business units and other departments.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As head of Product & Structure Introductions Multibrand you will lead a group responsible for monitoring and coordinating the inflow of product updates from R&D and doing the necessary preparations of these product updates that will make it possible to move out to the commercial organizations in each brand. You will also develop our ways of working to meet requirements in a new Multibrand context where we have all brands collaborating in a way we have never worked with before.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are a strong and highly motivated leader with a strategic mind but can act here and now. Previous management experience or other proven skills of leading people are of importance. You can work in a cross-functional and cross-brand environment and are interested in a holistic view of how the industrial and commercial systems work together to deliver results.
   

  

 New thinking, open-mindedness, driving change and cross-functional work should come naturally. The role will take you to many different environments, internally as well as externally so you will need to be competent in handling cultural differences and master English fluently. Swedish is not required. If you have managerial experience with any of the Traton brands and a background in cross-brand (collaborative) work we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 At Presales and Sales Readiness we celebrate differences and care deeply about diversity and inclusion – please motivate in your cover letter how your passion, attitude, experience and interest make you the perfect match for this position.
   

  

 If you think that you are suitable for this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**Further information and application**
 For more information, please contact Sara Ekman, Head of Multibrand Product Structure Introductions, KJX, +468 553 860 65.
   

  

 The position is available from 1st of September and I kindly ask you to apply as soon as possible as the last day for application is 30th of June.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Vikarierande administrativ chef till Kvarnbackaskolan
description:
Stockholm – vår huvudstad med miljoner drömmar, förväntningar och ambitioner. Vi jobbar för alla som lever här idag och i framtiden. Nu söker vi dig som vill tänka stort, nytt och annorlunda med oss – för stockholmarna.
   

  

 Välkommen till Kvarnbackaskolan
   

  

 Kvarnbackaskolan är en F-6 skola i Kista med 330 elever i grundskola och anpassad grundskola. För närvarande arbetar ca 85 personer på skolan och verksamheten bedrivs i våra två skolbyggnader som ligger bredvid varandra. På Kvarnbackaskolan arbetar vi med devisen "Alla barn är allas barn" utifrån en vision om att alla anställda på skolan är med och bygger framtiden för våra elever.
   

  

 Som vikarierande administrativ chef ansvarar du under läsåret 2024/25 för all personaladministration, ekonomi- och lönehantering samt frågor som rör lokalerna. Dessutom är du närmaste chef för den administrativa och skolrestaurangens personal.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 I rollen som administrativ chef så ingår du tillsammans med rektor och de två biträdande rektorerna i skolans ledningsgrupp. Där beslutar ni om ekonomiska satsningar, fattar strategiska beslut kring ex förändringar av lokalerna användning och processer för att följa upp personalfrånvaro. Men arbetet med elevernas kunskapsmässiga och sociala utveckling är alltid centrala i vårt arbete. Det är alltid hur våra beslut påverkar den enskilde elevens utveckling som står i centrum.
   

  

 Dina konkreta ansvarsområden är ekonomisk uppföljning och prognoser, personaladministration, dokumenthantering samt ledning av de övriga administrativa funktionerna på skolan samt vaktmästeri (med lokaler och städning som ligger på entreprenad) och skolrestaurangen. Skolrestaurangen leds av en kökschef men du är närmaste chef för de som arbetar där.
   

  

 Din kompetens och erfarenhet
   

  

 Vi söker dig med högskoleexamen inriktning ekonomi eller motsvarande. Det är nödvändigt att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i stadens olika system som Agresso, LISA, eDok och Hypergene. En omvittnat god erfarenhet av att arbeta på Utbildningsförvaltningen och med kännedom om övriga olika IT-system och funktioner som finns i staden är högt värderad och väldigt meriterande. Det är en bonus om du har erfarenhet av arbetsledning.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet, motivation och engagemang för tjänsten. Eftersom det ingår en hel av läsande, skrivande och kommunicerande (såväl internt som externt) i tjänsten, är dokumenterad god förmåga i det svenska språket av största vikt.
   

  

 I rollen som administrativ chef ingår också att ha många bollar i luften och en förmåga att kunna hantera stress och prioritera. Därför är din förmåga till ordning och reda något som är extra viktigt för att du på ett bra sätt ska kunna axla rollen.
   

  

 Stockholms stad arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering som syftar till att se till varje persons kompetens och därmed motverka diskriminering.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Kista | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/3388 | Kontakt: Janne Lindelöw 08-50845503, | Facklig företrädare: Behiye Arikan, Vision 076/1240782, Karin Wrannvik, Ledarna 076/1290750, | Publicerat: 2024-06-10 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-24

title: Head Of Project Procurement - Interior/Exterior
description:
Are you ready to be at the forefront of change? Scania is a world leading provider of transport solutions operating in over 100 countries. We set out to drive the shift towards sustainable transport systems that is better for business, society and the environment.
   

  

 As part of Scania's procurement team, you'll play a crucial role in fulfilling this mission by managing our extensive supplier network. Working closely with the other brands within the Traton group, we aim to deliver value and competitiveness through innovative, sustainable and resilient supply chain solutions.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?**
 The Project Interior/Exterior team is responsible for souring activities in development projects connected to the truck cabin such as seats, beds& storage, instrument panel, steering wheel and other cabin related components. The next few years the team is facing one of the most interesting and largest projects in the last decades and there will be opportunities to make an real impact and contribution for Scania and Traton’s success for many years to come.
   

  

 You will lead this diverse team of 10 dedicated purchasers considering the balance of Technology, Quality, Cost, Delivery and Sustainability with the goal to make the right supplier choices for Scania and Traton. This dynamic role involves engaging collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, offering a stimulating and rewarding environment. Reporting to the Head of Project Cabin and Electronics, you'll be an integral part of the Project procurement management team.
   

  

**What you’ll do?**
 As a group manager, you'll focus on developing, supporting, and coaching your team to achieve both collective targets and personal goals, fostering a culture of ownership and accountability while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. By understanding our customer needs and continuously adapt way of working, you'll drive continuous improvement, build a strong and diverse team as well as strive for optimal results. You will also be part of the Cabin and Electronics management team and help develop the department to meet the future needs of the Automotive industry.
   

  

 This position, the team and the management team is located in Södertälje, with possibilities for a hybrid work set up (office/ home). The role involves regular travel, as our internal and external counterparts are located worldwide.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We seek a manager with focus on building a strong team-spirit, with focus on coaching individuals to a high degree of own initiative and accountability. You are organized, flexible, like to take initiatives and are able to handle multiple activities in parallel. Excellent communication skills, especially in English is a must. Your integrity and accountability are unquestionable.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess relevant commercial experience, either with over five years of leadership in commercial management roles or a proven track record from automotive purchasing with demonstrated leadership capabilities. A university degree in relevant field is preferred.
   

  

**Further information**
 Contact Torbjörn Lilja, Director Project procurement Cabin and Electronics: +46 8 553 53322 or Babel Barisho, Talent Acquisition Specialist at babel.barisho@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a cover letter and CV. Please apply as soon as possible and no later than 2024-06-26. Selections and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis throughout the application period. A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Junior ServiceDesk technician to thrilling media company
description:
Welcome to the world of music and technology! In this role you will be instrumental in keeping the IT environment at the office running smoothly. Together with your team of IT desk colleagues you will solve all types of IT related issues whether its a phone, computer or printer that has a problem.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm city
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 In this role you will work the IT ServieDesk and help collegues with various IT related issues. The work space is primarily working in Apple devices so if you have experience in supporting those its a plus.
 


  


 Our client boasts a dynamic distributed workforce that stretches the globe and uses primarily Apple devices with a mix of Windows and Linux laptops as well as various mobile devices. A wide range of SaaS solutions, that constantly evolve, help improve productivity and you'll be at the forefront of supporting the user IT needs to ensure they are contributing to the company's mission.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* You will provide excellent IT-support experience to our global collaegues working from anywhere
  
* Evaluate and work in our ServiceDesk and other support channels
  
* Manage escalated requests and give personal and remote support on hardware and software problems to fellow employees
  
* Work closely and drive some changes with other teams to make sure alignment remains on a global scale within the IT Support area
  
* Administration and support of i.e Google Workspace, JAMF and centralized user management (LDAP)
  

  


**We are looking for**

 We believe that you are a team player that actively collaborates with your team, and in other locations, to find solutions to problems. You are self-motivated and active with the ability to work independently. You are dependable, have a sense of urgency and are able to meet deadlines. You have communication and customer support skills, maintaining a professional demeanor at all levels of the business. You are flexible and willing to adapt to fast and often occurring changes.
 


  

  
* Language: English
  
* You need a Swedish work permit and/or citizenship
  
* You live in Stockholm and are able to start immediately
  
* You have experience from working with JAMF and ServiceNow
  
* Preferably you have experience from a similar role
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Flexible
  
* Has a strong technical interest
  
* Structured
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Nils Norgren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on nils.norgren@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105125

title: Junior nätverkstekniker
description:
Som junior nätverkstekniker kommer du att arbeta med konfigurering av routrar och switchar, support och utveckling av nätverk. Vi erbjuder dig hjälp med att ta IT-certifikat.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som junior nätverkstekniker kommer du att arbeta med felsökning, supportering och analys av tekniska ärenden. De tekniska ärendena är av olika svårighetsgrad och omfattning, vilket erbjuder dig att utveckla din problemlösningsförmåga. Själva ärendet hämtar du från ett ärendehanteringssystem, telefon och mail, som du sedan löser efter bästa förmåga.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom nätverk
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande
* Du har arbetat som nätverkstekniker i minst 1 år


 Vi tror att du som söker tjänsten är en riktig problemlösande och tycker det är kul att supportera andra med ett trevligt bemötande i din vardag. Du tycker det är roligt att arbeta i team och lära dig från dina kollegor samt dela med dig av dina egna erfarenheter.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har arbetat i en teknisk kundtjänstroll tidigare och har vana att skapa ett förtroende hos användarna. Du bör känna till Active Directory, ha goda kunskaper i Windows 7 och 10, Exchange, Outlook.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.
   

  

**Omge dig med möjligheter på Centric** 
 Är du intresserad av nätverk och tycker om att supportera andra? Som junior nätverkstekniker kommer du att arbeta med konfigurering av routrar och switchar, support och utveckling av nätverk samt fungera som stöd för användare. Du kommer få utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper samt hålla en löpande dialog med andra tekniker.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.

title: Företag inom IT-infrastruktur söker Field Service Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Är du en tekniskt kunnig och lösningsorienterad person med erfarenhet inom datacenter? Vill du vara en del av ett innovativt företag som ligger i framkant av IT-infrastruktur och tekniska lösningar? På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en driven och engagerad Field Service Infrastructure Engineer för att stärka deras team och bidra till deras fortsatta framgång. Om du brinner för att leverera högkvalitativ teknisk support och vill arbeta i en dynamisk och utvecklande miljö, då kan detta vara möjligheten för dig!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 På uppdrag av kund söker vi nu en skicklig Field Service Infrastructure Engineer som kan arbeta på plats i deras kunders datacenter. Denna roll är avgörande för att tillhandahålla omfattande teknisk support till deras kunder och säkerställa smidig drift och distribution av kritisk datacenterinfrastruktur. Du kommer att bestå av ett team med nio kollegor med en spridning mellan kontoren i Borås och Stockholm. Det kan förekomma även förekomma jobb på annan ort.
 


  


 Kunden är ett ledande teknikföretag specialiserat på avancerade datacenterlösningar och IT-infrastruktur. De levererar tjänster inom bland annat datacenterinfrastruktur och IT-drift, säkra kommunikationslösningar, containertjänster, service och support 24/7, säkerhetslösningar, applikationsdrift och tredjepartsservice. De har strategiska partnerskap med ledande tillverkare och referenslösningar hos flera av Nordens mest krävande IT-verksamheter i både den privata och offentliga sektorn.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En dynamisk och stimulerande arbetsmiljö.
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt.
  
* Möjligheter till vidareutbildning och professionell utveckling.
  
* En tillsvidareanställning via Academic Work med fast månadslön. Goda möjligheter till överrekrytering efter 6 månader.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Incidenthantering för kontinuerlig drift.
  
* Hantering av olika datacenteraktiviteter, såsom att byta ut nätverksenheter, konfigurera servrar, utföra strömcykler och hantera kabeldragning/patchhantering.
  
* Generera periodiska rapporter enligt kundens specifikationer.
  
* Delta i felanalys enligt anvisningar från kundens ingenjörsteam.
  
* Tillhandahålla logistiskt stöd för tillgångshantering och datacenterplanering.
  
* Erbjuda detaljerad feedback till kunder om eventuella tjänsteproblem som påverkar SLA
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har examen inom ett datorrelaterat område (datorvetenskap, elektroteknik, telekommunikation eller liknande).
  
* Har 3 till 5 års relevant teknisk support-erfarenhet.
  
* Har stark kunskap om lagring, nätverk och serverhårdvara.
  
* Har bekantskap med Linux- och Windows-skriptning.
  
* Har kunskap om distributionsteknologier (WDS, PXE, DHCP, FTP) och administration av Windows Server OS och WinPE OS.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Certifiering inom CompTIA A+ eller motsvarande, CompTIA Server+ eller motsvarande, MCP/MCSE-certifiering.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Flexibel
  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Noggrann
  
* Problemlösare
  
* Prestigelös
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sophia Gyllenhammar eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105308

title: Data Analyst
description:
The resource will mainly work on analysis of the solutions being prepared for (tactical or strategic) , the resource will also work on designing the different layers of the datastore. Understanding the Business requirements and documenting them in required format as solution design. Creating HLM’s and mapping documents. Be a bridge between Product owner and developers developing the solution.
 



 10+ years of experience with IT projects. 4+ years as Senior IT Analyst
 



 o Description of the project: The resource will mainly work on analysis of the solutions being prepared for (tactical or strategic) for one of our project at Nordea.
 



 o Description of the daily tasks the subcon will need to perform:, the resource will work on designing the different layers of the datastore. Understanding the Business requirements and documenting them in required format as solution design. Creating HLM’s and mapping documents. Be a bridge between Product owner and developers developing the solution.
 



  





 o Must and Nice to Have skills: Data Analyst, IT Analyst
 



 o Years of experience in each skill: 10+ years of experience with IT projects. 4+ years as Senior IT Analyst

title: IT Project Manager
description:
**About the role** 




 As IT Project Manager you will lead and oversee our IT projects from inception to completion. You will be responsible for planning, executing, and closing projects. This role requires strong leadership skills, technical understanding, and exceptional communication abilities to facilitate the successful delivery of IT initiatives and projects.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Define project scope, objectives and deliverables in collaboration with Stakeholders and other PMs within the organization.
* Create a detailed project plan, including timelines, resource allocation and budget estimates.
* Develop and maintain project documentation, including project charters and communication plans.
* Assemble and lead cross-functional project teams, assigning tasks and responsibilities.
* Motivate and manage project team members to ensure a collaborative and productive work environment.
* Conduct regular project team meetings to provide updates, resolve issues and monitor progress.
* Conduct post-project evaluations to capture lessons learned and improve future project processes.



  





**Profile** 



* Minimum of 5 years' work experience, within ERP solutions
* Proven experience as an IT Project Manager with a track record of successfully managing complex IT projects.
* Understanding of the area of IT System Landscape
* Solid knowledge of IT systems and applications
* Knowledge of risk management, quality assurance, and change management process.
* Extensive experience from solution implementations and development
* Experience from retail industry is preferred



  





**Bonus points** 



* Extra qualities and skills that will be a plus for the role, but not necessary
* Enjoys working in a fast-paced global organization
* A humble team player with excellent communication and organization skills



  





 Apply with your CV and motivation in English
 **by 2024/08/12** 
 . Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that the position may be filled before the set end date. Interviews will start in mid August.
 



  





**About GANT** 




 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.

title: Teknisk support till Swedbank!
description:
Vi har fått möjligheten att rekrytera teknisk support till Swedbank. Är du en person som trivs att arbeta med kundsupport på ett effektivt och kvalitetssäkert sätt. Har du dessutom ett stort intresse för teknik och längtar efter en möjlighet att utvecklas i en supportroll? Då kan det vara dig vi söker för rollen som teknisk support inom betalningsområdet. Tveka inte på att skicka in din ansöka redan idag, start är beräknad till mitten av augusti och vi kommer kontakta dig som uppfyller kraven nedan.
 



  

**Företag :**
 Swedbank AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 38,5 h/vecka
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Academic Work söker för Swedbanks räkning teknisk support för ett uppdrag som inledningsvis gäller 6 månader. Du kommer bli en del av Technical Competence Center och E-pay-teamet inom Group Cards & Payments. Arbetsuppgifterna består av att bistå kunder med support för betalningstjänster via telefon och mejl, samt intern support till dina kollegor via ett internt ärendehanteringssystem. Teamet består idag av nio personer som sitter i öppet landskap på plats på kontoret i Sundbyberg.
 


  


  

**Denna tjänst kräver utdrag från belastningsregistret, vänligen ansök om detta hos polisen i samband med att du skickar in din ansökan då det kan ta upp till två veckor att få hem. Rätt utdrag hittar du**
  

**här!**



  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett spännande konsultuppdrag med möjlighet till förlängning/överrekrytering till banken.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Din främsta arbetsuppgift är att ge support till kunder för Swedbanks olika betalningsalternativ, exempelvis betalningar via fil, e-fakturatjänster, swishtjänster eller BankID. Utöver support förväntas du även ansvara för incidenthantering inom de olika betalningsområdena, vilket kan innebära att eskalera incidenter/driftstörningar till IT.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad gymnasial utbildning.
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av en roll inom support.
  
* Har ett stort tekniskt intresse.
  
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift.
  
* Har goda kunskaper i engelska både i tal och skrift.
  


  


 I denna rekryteringsprocess lägger vi stor vikt vid de personliga egenskaperna. Vi söker dig som är en nyfiken och orädd person. Du har viljan att lära dig och är orädd för att våga testa dig fram. Vi ser även att du har ett stort tekniskt intresse för att vilja grotta ner dig i betalningsfiler, system och dess komplexitet. Utöver detta är du bra på att förhålla dig till deadlines där din förmåga att prioritera bland olika arbetsuppgifter är ytterst viktig.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Socialt självsäker
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Beatrice Hyllstam eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts06@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105396

title: DevOps Engineer (Azure DevOps/C#) - API Platform
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**This is a full-time position with placement in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Description**
 If building and maintaining technology platforms excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The API Platform team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer who will play a critical role in designing, implementing and maintaining the deployments and integration processes for H&Ms API platform. The platform enables our product teams around the world to deploy software solutions that run independently. You will be part of a high-performance team that constantly aims to improve the experience of our end users and you. In this role, you will also be partnering with teams and areas to support our unit in driving the integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap.
   

  

 Some of your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work on ways to automate and improve development and release processes
* Identify technical problems in the pipelines, implement software updates and fixes
* Evaluate, build and implement new development tools and infrastructure
* Ensure systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats
* Deliver on time, demonstrating strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Align on CI/CD guidelines/guardrails with our Developer Experience Unit
* Drive refactoring of legacy systems, to help enable decoupling and modernize the software architecture
* Build the simplest possible solution that fulfils functional and quality requirements
* Actively apply best practices within CI/CD
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation
* Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years IT experience with at least 6 years working with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP)
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementing and managing Azure DevOps pipelines and YAML-based pipeline configurations
* Hands-on with languages & tools relevant to CI/CD Pipeline implementation e.g. .NET, C#, PowerShell, Bash etc.
* Good expertise and experience with DevOps services administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of pipelines
* Hands-on with managing and troubleshooting coupled integrations for SCM, Key Vaults, Logging and alert systems etc.
* Experience leveraging IaC (Infrastructure as Code) for deployment automation using Terraform, ARM template etc. on Microsoft Azure & Google Cloud Platform
* In-depth experience with API management platform (Azure preferred)
* Hands-on experience with Azure CLI and/or PowerShell & REST API
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Experience with industry best practices, strategies and troubleshooting for integration, build and deploy capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience in deployment using GitHub actions is highly desirable
* Knowledge and experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is meriting
* Preferred to have at least Azure Administrator (AZ104) and/or Developer (AZ204) certifications
* Azure Solution Architect (AZ305) and/or DevOps Engineer (AZ400) are strong plus!
* Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker and Kubernetes) is meriting
* Ability to design, document and clearly communicate ideas or issues
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira/Confluence, Miro etc.


**Additional Information**
 Working with tech at H&M Group
   

  

 The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers' technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You are joining a unique value-driven culture, a large tech network and community where you can be yourself. Besides the obvious perks such as staff discount card, learning communities, wellness and parental benefits, there are a lot of opportunities to experiment and grow in the direction you want. Being a major player gives us countless opportunities to make a real impact and shape the future.
   

  

 H&M Group is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age. Learn more about our I&D work https://youtu.be/veRbl9Cijts
   

  

 This is a full-time position based in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 30th of June. We will review and interview applicants on-going. If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Hranda Khrystyna at khrystyna.hranda@hm.com
